search_information.query_displayed: The Impact of Prestige Orientation on Shadow Education in South Korea Lee, Soojeong Shouse, Roger C. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: The impact of prestige orientation on shadow education in South Korea
organic_results.snippet: Widespread use of “shadow education,” is a major policy issue in East Asia, especially South Korea, where officials view it as harmful to educational and fiscal equity. Although previous research emphasizes functional explanations, this study takes an institutional approach, exploring how students' desire for prestigious matriculation influences their parents' spending on shadow education. It is around that that “prestige orientation”(1) significantly predicts parent spending, especially among students of lower socioeconomic …

publication_info.summary: S Lee, RC Shouse - Sociology of Education, 2011 - journals.sagepub.com
